2018-12-04.weather-summary: Light snow (< 1 in.) on Monday and next Tuesday, with high temperatures falling to 35°F on Saturday.

news.title: C.I.A. Briefing on Khashoggi Solidifies Senators’ View of Prince Mohammed’s Complicity
news.abstract: “There is not a smoking gun, there’s a smoking saw,” Senator Lindsey Graham said after a briefing by the C.I.A. director, Gina Haspel.
news.image-caption: Gina Haspel, the director of the C.I.A., briefed senators on the killing of Jamal Khashoggi on Tuesday.

news.title: Trump to Meet With Kim Jong-un, Despite North Korea’s Lapses, Bolton Says
news.abstract: John R. Bolton, the national security adviser, said the North’s lack of progress on ending its nuclear program left room for a new meeting, likely in early 2019, to be productive.
news.image-caption: President Trump and the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, at their summit meeting in Singapore in June. A second meeting is likely in January or February, said John R. Bolton, the national security adviser.

news.title: Pompeo Questions the Value of International Groups Like U.N. and E.U.
news.abstract: Speaking in Brussels, the secretary of state said that some institutions fail to serve their member nations, and should be revised or eliminated.

news.title: Stocks Slide After Trump Tweets on Trade, While Bond Market Sounds Recession Warning
news.abstract: The yield curve — the difference between the interest rates on short- and long-term Treasury bonds — is at its narrowest level since 2007, in what some see as an ominous sign for the economy.

news.title: Trump, Self-Styled ‘Tariff Man,’ Issues China a Warning
news.abstract: Giving himself the nickname on Twitter, the president said he would impose additional tariffs if China did not live up to promises made on the G-20 sidelines.

news.title: Trump Offers German Automakers a Pause on Car Tariffs, for Now
news.abstract: A hastily organized White House meeting came as fears were rising in Europe that the president may follow through on threats to impose car tariffs.
news.image-caption: A BMW factory in Greer, S.C., produces about 1,400 vehicles a day.

news.title: Wisconsin Legislature Live Updates: A Fight Over Governor’s Power
news.abstract: After losing top state offices, Republican lawmakers are racing to pass legislation that would diminish the power of the incoming Democratic governor.

2018-12-06.weather-summary: Light snow (< 1 in.) today, with high temperatures falling to 21°F on Tuesday.

news.title: Arrest of Chinese Executive Intensifies Trade War Fears
news.abstract: The arrest of Meng Wanzhou, an executive at the Chinese company Huawei, could imperil trade talks. But it is part of the Trump administration’s efforts to contain China and Iran.

news.title: Arrest of Top Huawei Executive Sends Stocks Lower
news.abstract: Wall Street started Thursday with another sell-off after the arrest of a Huawei executive threatened to upend an fragile trade truce between the United States and China.

news.title: Arrest Shakes Huawei as Global Skepticism of Its Business Grows
news.abstract: Britain, New Zealand, Australia and other countries have grown increasingly worried about potential security risks related to the Chinese telecom giant.
news.image-caption: A shopping mall in Shanghai on Thursday. China sees Huawei as a main driver of its ambitions for technological leadership. But much of the world sees it as a potential conduit for espionage and sabotage.

news.title: Trump Plans Major Rollback of Sage Grouse Protections to Spur Oil Exploration
news.abstract: The proposal would limit the bird’s protected habitat to just 1.8 million acres, essentially opening up nine million acres of land to drilling.
news.image-caption: A plan to roll back sage grouse protections is expected to be finalized in 2019.

news.title: ‘Yellow Vest’ Protests Shook France. Here’s the Lesson for Climate Change.
news.abstract: There is little doubt among scientists and economists that carbon taxes are needed to reduce fossil fuel dependence. The question is how to design them to cushion the blow on the most vulnerable.
news.image-caption: France’s suspension of a fuel tax increase after violent protests signaled the perils that governments in wealthier countries may face in setting policies to fight climate change.

news.title: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Accelerate Like a ‘Speeding Freight Train’ in 2018
news.abstract: Accelerating emissions are putting the world on track to face some of the most severe consequences of global warming sooner than expected, scientists said.
news.image-caption: Daytime traffic amid smog in Beijing on Sunday. China produces 27 percent of global carbon emissions, the most of any country.

news.title: Making President Trump’s Bed: A Housekeeper Without Papers
news.abstract: At the president’s New Jersey golf course, an undocumented immigrant has worked as a maid since 2013. She said she never imagined she “would see such important people close up.”
news.image-caption: Victorina Morales at her home in Bound Brook, N.J. She left Guatemala in 1999 and illegally entered the United States. She started working at the Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster, N.J., in 2013.
